lines.text:
[narrating]
To my knowledge it is the only trial in the history of American jurisprudence that was over in just two spoken words.

[speaking out loud]
I... I do.
you with your selective senses, and me with my lawyer front man.
All this time, and he never spoke...
[Sammy leaves the town by bus]

[narrating]
I gave a lot of the money away. Norm and Lucille would never have to live in a bus shelter again. Tallassee would go around the world taking pictures to her heart's content. The Tynan home would become an estate for lost boys. As for Tolliver, I felt I had lost an enemy but gained a brother, so I felt an obligation to take care of his pocket money while he served his prison term...
[last lines]

[sits next to Sammy]
So... what are your plans?
I... I guess I don't have any at the moment.
Then I guess I got on the right bus.
I have something to show you.
[takes out his mother's music box]
if people thought you were deaf and not able to talk, they blurt out their true feelings without holding back.

[to Norm Jenkins]
From time to time... I thought if ever I could pick out a father, it might be somebody pretty close to being like you. Not exactly. Close.

[at the bonfire, trying to get the reporters to stop bothering Sammy]
Hi!
Well! Someone who can talk. What's your name?
Uh, Joan of Arc. I love bonfires!
I see you have some Dickie Devil records, for the blaze no doubt.
Oh, no. These are some Frank Sinatra albums of my mother's that I've been longing to incinerate for a while.
Take Sammy with you. Tolliver has some work for him at the church.
Yes, ma'am.
And make sure he rides in the back. I don't want people to see him riding up front with you.
Maybe I can just tie a rope around him and make him run along behind.
Burn 'em I say.
Oh, he's good.
Don't you think cremation is a little harsh?
Reverend, you must be proud of this event you've inspired.
They're gonna ruin the lawn!
This isn't gonna be a highway interchange. This is the nothin'est nothin' I ever saw.
Maybe there's oil under here. Maybe we're floating on a gusher and don't even know it.
There's no oil under here! What we are floating on is the parking lot repaving fund, the parish renovation fund, the organ fund...
I'm just repeatin' what Finis said...
Finis is full of exhaust!

[about Sammy]
You'd better find a decent place for him, Norm, and fast, because this is the world's poorest excuse for an orphanage!
[the church is on fire]
Some of my people may still be in there!
[runs inside]
